text: Alison Brown is emeritus professor in the department of history at Royal Holloway, University of London.Professor Alison Brown. Royal Holloway, University of London. Retrieved 30 May 2015. Brown is a specialist in the history of Renaissance Italy. ==Selected publications== *Bartolomeo Scala, 1430-1497, Chancellor of Florence: the humanist as bureaucrat. Princeton, N.J., Princeton University Press, 1979. *The Renaissance. London, Longman, 1988. (Seminar Studies in History) *Language and images of Renaissance Italy. Oxford, Clarendon Press, 1995. (Editor) *Contested Space: Street Trading, Public Space, and Livelihoods in Developing Countries. Rugby, ITDG Publishing, 2006. *The return of Lucretius to Renaissance Florence. Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press, 2010. *Medicean and Savonarolan Florence: the interplay of politics, humanism, and religion, Brepols, 2011. == References == ==External links== *Alison Brown speaking on Machiavelli's The Prince.
